adjective.description: Equipped with or carrying a weapon or weapons.
examples: the security forces are armed with automatic rifles

adjective.description: Having claws, a beak, etc. of a specified tincture.

phrases: The Bedford, a NATO battleship armed to the teeth, is on patrol in the North Atlantic when it receives two guests via helicopter.
Two warriors, armed to the teeth, stand alert, ready to defend the demolition team in case of a raid by bandits.
Twenty-two men exited the aircraft, all clothed in dark fatigues and all armed to the teeth.
